benchmark_details.name: BASIR (Budget-Assisted Sectoral Impact Ranking)
benchmark_details.overview: BASIR is an annotated dataset mapping excerpts from Indian Union Budget transcripts (1947-2025) to sectoral impacts, facilitating the identification and ranking of sectors based on their predicted performance influenced by budget announcements.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically identify and rank sectors based on their expected performance following Indian Union Budget announcements.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The annotation approach may overlook subtle sector relationships. Temporal coverage is limited to data available post-1997, potentially missing long-term effects.

data.source: A comprehensive corpus of Union Budget transcripts from the Ministry of Finance of India spanning from 1947 to 2025.
data.size: 1,600+ excerpts for sector identification, 400+ texts for sector ranking
data.annotation: Manually validated sector tagging based on sector-company mapping and budget transcript text.

methods: Multi-label sector classification using fine-tuned embeddings and language models
Performance ranking based on predicted sector returns
methodology.calculation: Performance is calculated based on the difference in opening prices for constituent companies of sectors around budget announcements.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better sector classification performance; NDCG scores reflect better ranking performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Acc achieved 0.605 F1 score and 0.997 NDCG score in sector ranking.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation methods employed for robustness in sector performance prediction.
